This brings man to access to less knowledge, than referring two to three books. This is a tremondous change occured all over trhe world.  When we speak about the areas of computer usage we could not find any space without the access of a computer or computer related gadgets which are used to make the work easier. The people gets moved by the recent technology  available to them and get addicted to itself. Even from kids we can feel this tendency over the access of computer. They prefer more to this technologies and thus taking away the essentials which are needed for the real growth of their mental ability and physical formations. Today`s world never finds time to get engaged in physical games and physical meetings. The technology made them to sit in rooms and made them to bring the whole world into their room. This is going to be in its top most level during the coming years.

 Hence by analysing the whole world scenario we could understand that  technology has a wide acceptance in our midst. We are taken away by the technology. This is going to harm ourselves and the generations to come. The extreme access and dependence to computer and computer related objects makes man a toy and techoinlogy as his master.

Auto industry in the US and the Europe falls under a crisis by the decrease in sales of their products during the year 2013. The major reason for the decline in the sales is due to unempoloyment rate which has increased to its peak in United States. In order to over come the situation The US government has extended the average life of cars to 11.3 years  from 10.8 which was in 2012. This scenario made banks in Us  under great dilemmma, and they offered customers high loan amounts with very less intrest rates to purchase new cars. The over all sales of auto units in the US has declined by 1.1 %, that is 14.5 % sales in the year 2012 by 13.4% sales in the year 2013.

When we peep into the Eurpean market the situation is still the similar.The financial crisis in europe and the inflation made much declibne in the auto sales mainly General Motors and Ford who were the market leaders in Europe. Europe has faced  an year over year decline over sales in cars and the less demand for cars by the customers. The banks also felt reluctant to give finance and loans for new car purchases. Reuters , the leading news reporters of the world reported that the decline in sales was the steepest compared to previous years where they qouted the decrease to 11.3%  which is roughly 9 million units of cars.

The European continent faced the hard face, reports European Automobile Manufactures Association.  Most of the auto manufacturing and sales units  made a cut off in the number of employees and many of them made their decision to close the plants as they couldnt manage these work force under a great loss. Europe faced its highest rate of unempoloyment over these  days and reached 26.5 million by March 2013 by 10.9% percentage compared to 10.3 which was is the year 2012. The major car makers of the globe The Ford plans to shut down its units in UK and Belgium by 2015 and General Motors decides to suspend the production activities at United Kingdom. The financial crisis made other leading auto manufactures like Renault , Fiat, Peugeot, Honda etc to eliminate thousands of jobs. 

Reuters describes the effect of inflation and financial crisis which made the leading market owners in the auto sector face a harsh time in their business line. The whole globe felt the crisis and each sector got affected in one way or the another.

June 2013 - Auto Industry Outlook for the US and Europe

U.S. Market Recovery

Strong pent-up demand due to aging vehicles on the U.S. roads along with falling unemployment rate have been the key factors in driving the auto sales in the U.S. Average age of vehicles on U.S. roads increased to 11.3 years in January 2013 from 10.8 years in 2012. Banks were also friendlier as they offered greater access to loans with lower interest rates.

Auto sales in the U.S. grew 13.4% to the five-year high of 14.5 million vehicles in 2012. In May 2013, auto sales in the U.S. grew 8.2% to 1.44 million units while it rose 10.9% to 15.3 million vehicles on a seasonally adjusted rate (SAAR) basis.

Economic Crisis in Europe

The present Eurozone financial crisis has adversely affected the operations of many global automakers, especially GM and Ford, who have a significant exposure to the market. Car sales in Europe continued to be low owing to weak consumer confidence on the back of a weak economy triggered by the crisis.

According to the European Automobile Manufacturers` Association (ACEA), car sales in Europe reached its lowest level of 12.05 million units in 2012 since 1995, indicating a year-over-year decline of 8.2% due to the sagging demand for cars, as highly indebted banks were reluctant to finance new car purchases for customers. The decline was the steepest in the highly troubled Eurozone, where car sales dipped 11.3% to roughly 9 million units, according to Reuters.

Most of the major automakers in Europe are resorting to job cuts and plant closures, as it became no longer feasible for them to undertake full-fledged operations in the continent. Unemployment in the EU reached 26.5 million in Mar 2013, while the unemployment rate increased to 10.9% in the same month from 10.3% in Mar 2012.

Among the U.S. automakers, Ford plans to shut vehicle and component plants in the U.K. and Belgium in the next two years while General Motors would suspend car production at its Bochum plant in Germany -- which employs 3,100 workers -- in 2016.

Among the European automakers, Renault plans to retrench 7,500 jobs in France by 2016 while each of Fiat and Peugeot has decided to eliminate 1,500 jobs. Among the Japanese automakers, Honda announced plans to terminate 800 jobs at its South Marston plant near Swindon, southwest England in the second quarter of 2013.
